bug.author: cbasavaraj
bug.summary: üêõ [Bug] Docker container build fails on Ubuntu 18.04
bug.description:
Hi, I'd like to try the Jupyter notebook here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NVIDIA/TRTorch/tree/master/notebooks>https://github.com/NVIDIA/TRTorch/tree/master/notebooks</denchmark-link>
When I try I get this error on Step 14: <denchmark-code>Step 14/21 : RUN bazel build //:libtrtorch --compilation_mode opt ---> Running in d67d7bd7b5b8 Extracting Bazel installation... Starting local Bazel server and connecting to it... Loading: Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Analyzing: target //:libtrtorch (1 packages loaded, 0 targets configured) Analyzing: target //:libtrtorch (36 packages loaded, 139 targets configured) INFO: Analyzed target //:libtrtorch (39 packages loaded, 2499 targets configured). INFO: Found 1 target... [0 / 76] [Prepa] Writing file include.args [454 / 520] Compiling core/conversion/evaluators/aten.cpp; 14s processwrapper-sandbox ... (4 actions, 3 running) [464 / 520] Compiling core/conversion/converters/impl/stack.cpp; 19s processwrapper-sandbox ... (4 actions, 3 running) ERROR: /workspace/TRTorch/core/lowering/BUILD:10:11: C++ compilation of rule '//core/lowering:lowering' failed (Exit 1) gcc failed: error executing command /usr/bin/gcc -U_FORTIFY_SOURCE -fstack-protector -Wall -Wunused-but-set-pa rameter -Wno-free-nonheap-object -fno-omit-frame-pointer -g0 -O2 '-D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=1' -DNDEBUG -ffunction-sections ... (remaining 61 argument(s) skipped)
Use --sandbox_debug to see verbose messages from the sandbox core/lowering/lowering.cpp:2:10: fatal error: torch/csrc/jit/passes/create_functional_graphs.h: No such file or directory #include "torch/csrc/jit/passes/create_functional_graphs.h" ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ compilation terminated. Target //:libtrtorch failed to build Use --verbose_failures to see the command lines of failed build steps. INFO: Elapsed time: 270.936s, Critical Path: 32.27s INFO: 19 processes: 19 processwrapper-sandbox. FAILED: Build did NOT complete successfully FAILED: Build did NOT complete successfully </denchmark-code>
I'm on a Google Cloud instance with Ubuntu 18.04, Python 3.6 and CUDA 10.2. Thanks

comments.comment: Think this is just a matter of updating the Notebook container dockerfile

Can you please explain a bit more? I tried FROM nvcr.io/nvidia/tensorrt:20.07-py3 in the first line of notebooks/Dockerfile.notebook instead of the old version 20.03, but then I get this error below. I've CUDA installed, so the path /usr/local/cuda-10.2 definitely exists. <denchmark-code>Step 14/21 : RUN bazel build //:libtrtorch --compilation_mode opt ---> Running in 19bc3989dbfd Extracting Bazel installation... Starting local Bazel server and connecting to it... Loading: Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Loading: 0 packages loaded Analyzing: target //:libtrtorch (1 packages loaded, 0 targets configured) Analyzing: target //:libtrtorch (36 packages loaded, 139 targets configured) Analyzing: target //:libtrtorch (36 packages loaded, 139 targets configured) ERROR: /root/.cache/bazel/_bazel_root/dbd0cda766b91a08d9f8b4d01d528393/external/tensorrt/BUILD.bazel:83:11: @tensorrt//:nvinfer depends on @cuda//:cudart in repository @cuda which failed to fetch. no such package '@cuda//': The repository's path is "/usr/local/cuda-10.2/" (absolute: "/usr/local/cuda-10.2") but this directory does not exist. ERROR: /root/.cache/bazel/_bazel_root/dbd0cda766b91a08d9f8b4d01d528393/external/tensorrt/BUILD.bazel:83:11: @tensorrt//:nvinfer depends on @cuda//:cublas in repository @cuda which failed to fetch. no such package '@cuda//': The repository's path is "/usr/local/cuda-10.2/" (absolute: "/usr/local/cuda-10.2") but this directory does not exist. ERROR: Analysis of target '//:libtrtorch' failed; build aborted: Analysis failed INFO: Elapsed time: 197.855s INFO: 0 processes. FAILED: Build did NOT complete successfully (38 packages loaded, 1410 targets configured) FAILED: Build did NOT complete successfully (38 packages loaded, 1410 targets configured) </denchmark-code>
Did you find a way to make this run on a container?
Nope :( I'm gonna try building from scratch unless there's a response.
Notebooks should be updated, reopen if there are issues.
